title: Head for Texas
description: Gene faces trouble on two fronts when he befriends a young man accused of murder and his ranch hands frame him for rustling Miss Sandy's cattle.

title: Gold Dust Charlie
description: When an old prospector is shot after making a rich gold strike, Gene files the claim on his behalf and is promptly accused of murder by the town sheriff.

title: The Silver Arrow
description: When ranchers are slain with silver arrows, Gene suspects that someone is trying to throw suspicion on the local Indians to cover an even bigger crime.

title: The Doodle Bug
description: Gene investigates a series of gold-shipment robberies.

title: The Star Toter
description: Gene tries to reform the young son of an outlaw. When the bad man escapes, the boy must choose between his murderous father and the honest life Gene would like him to lead.

title: The Double Switch
description: When the state agrees to build a road if the county provides matching funds, Harlow enthusiastically supports the idea and contributes a large sum as seed money. He plans to steal his own money back, along with his neighbors contributions to the highway project.

title: Blackwater Valley Feud
description: A crook tries to grab two adjacent ranches owned by feuding families by murdering one man and framing another.

title: Doublecross Valley
description: Gene investigates why a gang is trying so hard to gain control of an unprofitable ranch. During his investigation, he discovers a cache of gold.

roles.char: Parker Gang Henchman in Leather Vest

title: The Posse
description: An outlaw gang try to convince a former crook to help them rob Gene's safe.

title: The Devil's Brand
description: Foreman Gene Autry sends for the niece of his murdered boss, so she can take over the ranch, but a brother-sister team of outlaws kidnaps the woman and places an impostor in her place. The stagecoach driver discovers the replacement but is shot by the gang leader. Before he dies, he leaves Gene and Pat a cryptic clue.

title: Six-Shooter Sweepstakes
description: Champion loses a fixed horse race, but helps Gene track down a gang of bank robbers.

title: The Poisoned Waterhole
description: After nearly drinking from a poisoned waterhole, Gene and Pat finds themselves in the middle of a fight between railroad workers and an Indian tribe.

title: The Lost Chance
description: Gene and Pat rescue a young Mexican boy who is forced to locate an old mine by outlaws who threaten to kill the youngster's burro.

title: The Black Rider
description: While traveling on the trail Gene sees a man killed. Later he discovers the killer is known as the Black Rider has been terrorizing a local town since a recent court case. Gene quickly discovers the Black Rider intends to add him to the growing list of victims.

title: Gun Powder Range
description: A young lad decides a life of an outlaw is more exciting than day to day living. Things become complicated when Gene tries to teach the boy a lesson. Instead they are confused for real outlaws by the local authorities and a life and death situation quickly develops.

title: Twisted Trails
description: Gene encounters a young boy hiding in a barn. He takes the lad in and soon discovers the boy is searching for his father, a supposed local rancher. It soon turns out his father has turned to a life of crime to survive.

title: The Fight at Peaceful Mesa
description: Gene and Pat are visiting Peaceful Mesa when they get caught up in a gun battle, as the dust settles they discover there is a three cornered argument about the inheritance of a ranch

title: Hot Lead
description: Gene purchases a new horse which is then used by a gang of bank robbers to make good their escape. Gene sets out on the twin mission of retrieving his horse and capture the bank robbers.

title: The Gray Dude
description: Gene teams up with a local sheriff to try and track down the man responsible for the death of a mutual friend. Things become strained when they cross a county line and meet with a sheriff who is less than helpful and completely unsympathetic to their mission.

title: The Killer Horse
description: Gene gets involved in the search for a race horse thats gone wild. The situation becomes complicated when the same horse might be responsible for a number of recent deaths in the area.

roles.char: Short Posse Member with First Body

title: The Peacemaker
description: Gene encounters a cowboy who tries to rob him. The man dies after he steals Gene's horse and falls. On his body Gene finds a cryptic note about events in a nearby town. On investigating he discovers a strange series of events surrounding the potential of water in the area.

title: The Sheriff of Santa Rosa
description: Gene is acting as the sheriff of Santa Rosa while the are is being hit by a mysterious gang of horse rustlers. The townsfolk have many theories about who is responsible and it is up to Gene to solve the case before innocent people get hurt.

title: T.N.T.
description: Gene Autry is under pressure to sell a piece of land he needs for a water supply. The buyer turns to some dubious practices to try and convince Autry to sell.

title: The Raiders
description: Gene is asked to try and solve a series of payroll holdups that threaten to stop construction of a much needed dam in the area. Things become complicated when a young woman comes to town to meet the man she will marry.

roles.char: Gus, Card Player in Checked Shirt

title: Ghost Town Raiders
description: Gene parades as an outlaw to try and get information on a robbery a few years before.

title: Frontier Guard
description: Gene gets caught up in a kidnapping attempt when he stumbles into a town where competing interests are trying gain control of a ranch in a strategic location on the edge of the Mexican border.

title: Silver Dollars
description: Gene interrupts a silver bullion robbery and learns that it is just one in a series of such robberies. While investigating it becomes obvious that someone is tipping the robbers off as to which wagons to attack and how much silver is being carried.

title: Killer's Trail
description: Gene is hot on the trail of El Avengador (The Avenger), but he may be chasing the wrong person.

title: Frame for Trouble
description: Gene and Pat capture a hired killer. From a letter in his pocket, Gene discovers that the assassin had planned to keep a appointment with the man who hired him. When Gene arrives at the rendezvous, he is arrested for murder.

title: Warning! Danger!
description: Gene and Pat try to help a pair of orphans whose other brother has reluctantly joined a gang of train robbers.

title: Revenge Trail
description: Gene Autry is on the trail of a series of unexplained murders in the territory. The only common link is a piece of rope tied in a special knot. He needs to understand the significance of the clue before any other murders take place.

title: The Bandits of Boulder Bluff
description: Gene returns to Boulder Bluff for a holiday and discovers that a man posing as a US marshal is a wanted criminal. Gene sets out to warn the townsfolk and attempt to capture the man before anyone gets hurt

title: Outlaw Escape
description: Pat is elected as sheriff of the town and asks Gene to be his deputy. What seems to be a fairly easy duty soon turns deadly serious when word comes through that the notorious murderer Red Lambert has broken out of jail and is headed for the town.

title: The Kid Comes West
description: An old man on the verge of dying wills his ranch to a grandson no one knew he had. This upsets a series plans other ranches have for the area. Gene must make sure the child makes it to the ranch to claim the inheritance.

title: Return of Maverick Dan
description: Gene is visiting the town of Cotton Wood when he hears of the forceful eviction of Barbara Blake from her home. She has been holding out for the return of her older brother "Maverick Dan" who is wanted on a series of charges including murder. As Gene investigates he begins to have doubts about the man's guilt.

title: Galloping Hoofs
description: Neal Pierson, a convicted embezzler, escapes from prison and heads for his partner Curt Wayne's ranch to avenge a double cross.

title: Heir to the Lazy L
description: Gene inherits half a ranch and while he is riding to complete the details, he is attacked by three men intent on killing him. At the ranch he discovers things are tense between other local land owners and the other part owner of his ranch.

title: Melody Mesa
description: Gene pretends to be a singing teacher in order to infiltrate a counterfeiting gang.

title: Horse Sense
description: Gene has one of his horses stolen and another killed, he follows the trail to a town where opposing forces are bidding for a cavalry resupply contract. Gene comes to the realization that the man responsible for the theft may be a particularly cruel horse trainer.

roles.char: Horseman Forcing Adams Out of Town

title: Rock River Feud
description: Pat Buttram inherits a stagecoach line from a murdered relative, but even with Gene Autry's help, the road is very rocky.

title: The Lawless Press
description: Gene and Pat investigate a crooked newspaper editor who composes stories of crimes before they're even committed.

title: The Western Way
description: Young Billy Walker rides with the infamous Brady gang, which worries his mother, Ma Walker, sick. Gene comes to the rescue and helps Billy escape from the gang.

title: The Ruthless Renegade
description: Gene arrives in the town of Dry Gulch and becomes the sheriff almost by accident. He discovers the town is dominated by the mayor and the judge is in his control. Gene looks for way to work around these issues while trying to help a local victimized newspaper owner.

title: Hot Lead and Old Lace
description: Pete Munroe is shot dead in an effort to get his ranch, which he has left to his niece Maude. She proves stronger than expected, but Gene Autry and Pat Buttram must help her hold on to her inheritance.

title: Blazeaway
description: Gene is sent by his commanding officer to investigate a series of murders in the town of Blazeaway. The settlers believe the killings were caused by Indians using tomahawks, but the Native Americans claim they've been framed to drive them from their land.

roles.char: Gray Badger - Indian with Bow and Arrow

title: Bullets & Bows
description: Pat Buttram owns a tailor shop but is spectacularly unsuccessful, and Gene must protect him from the local land grabbers.

title: Trouble at Silver Creek
description: Gene witnesses a murder and manages to arrest the man. Unfortunately elements within the town secure the man's escape. A woman is pushed into a loveless marriage with the exception her father's farm will be saved.

title: Six Gun Romeo
description: Adelle Tompkins arrives on the stagecoach with plans to marry Pat Buttram, but Pat has sent her Gene Autry's picture instead of his own. On the same stage is Jan Carter Gray, who has come to meet her gang of outlaws for less lofty purposes.

title: The Sheriff Is a Lady
description: Sheriff Kathy Vale mistakes Gene and Pat for two desperate outlaws. Gene sings his way out of trouble.

title: The Trail of the Witch
description: After a series of stagecoach robberies threaten to shut down a town's gold mines, a young sheriff requests the help of Gene and Pat to round up the outlaws.

title: Thunder Out West
description: A crook uses Pat's new telescope to get the combination of a safe with a large amount of cash inside.

roles.char: Slender Thug in the White Hat

title: Outlaw Stage
description: Gene attempts to clear a young stagecoach driver accused of complicity in a fatal stagecoach hold-up. Pat, believing he is suffering from a fatal illness, attempts to tackle the entire gang single-handed.

title: Ghost Mountain
description: Gene and Pat help an archaeologist capture outlaws pretending to be the ghosts of Spanish conquistadors.

title: The Old Prospector
description: Gene and Pat help an elderly prospector get a full-time job as a miner, but a pair of outlaws kidnap the old man and try to force him to reveal where he found a large gold nugget.

title: Narrow Escape
description: Gene and Pat investigate a series of stagecoach hold-ups with the help of a newspaper editor and a young widow and her son who have answered Pat's ad in a lonely-hearts column.

title: Border Justice
description: Gene and Pat help the Mexican police apprehend smugglers who use an American bakery as a front for their illegal operations.

title: Gypsy Wagon
description: When an elderly gypsy and his lovely daughter surprise outlaws holding up a stagecoach, the thieves try to kill the witnesses before they can be identified.

title: Bandidos
description: An outlaw impersonates a U.S. Senator to steal money the taxpayers have raised to build an irrigation project.

title: Dry Gulch at Devil's Elbow
description: Gene tries to help a small-town sheriff rid his town of outlaws, but he and Pat are soon in need of rescue themselves when they become prisoners of the gang.

title: Cold Decked
description: Gene helps a banker who is accused of embezzling the bank's assets.

title: Steel Ribbon
description: Gene and Pat investigate a series of payroll robberies from a railroad and discover that the outlaw gang is receiving inside information.

roles.char: Cole, Beefy Henchman in Checked Shirt

title: Rio Renegades
description: An outlaw gang learns of gold ore shipments through a female confederate's hairdressing shop.

title: Ransom Cross
description: After two archaeologists discover an ancient Spanish cross, a trio of crooks steal it and hold the relic for ransom.

title: Santa Fe Raiders
description: Gene tries to help an old friend fend off attacks on his freight line. When the old man is murdered, Gene tries to help his son keep the company solvent.

title: Johnny Jackeroo
description: Gene reluctantly agrees to help Pat throw a scare into an obnoxious eleven-year-old boy by staging a stagecoach hold-up, but two disgruntled ranch hands take advantage of the situation by actually robbing the stage while disguised as Autry and Buttram.

title: Holdup
description: A father-daughter team of crooks tries to grab the Flying M Ranch for the oil contained under the property.

title: Prize Winner
description: Afraid of being searched while he was in possession of stolen gems, Doc McCoy hid the jewels in a chicken's feed trough. Later, Pat refuses to sell his prize chicken to McCoy, so the villain resorts to chicken rustling.

title: The Sharpshooter
description: An escaped convict convinces Gene and Pat that he was framed for murdering the town's old sheriff. With the help of the judge who convicted him, Gene gathers evidence against the murdered man's former deputy.

title: Talking Guns
description: Three outlaws use crazy Jim Decker's home as a base of operations for their robbery's.

title: Hoodoo Canyon
description: A banker and his scheming daughter try to run a stagecoach line out of business so they can take over the lucrative business.

title: The Carnival Comes West
description: Gene and Pat are puzzled when a reputable townswoman tries to prevent a carnival from giving a show in town.

title: Battle Axe
description: After a series of robberies, the town sheriff is forced to resign. He's replaced by a headstrong woman who falls for a smooth-talking confidence man who is actually the leader of the gang.

title: Outlaw of Blue Mesa
description: To avenge the death of his father, a miner, a young man robs stagecoaches belonging to the mine's owner, but discovers that the strongboxes which supposedly contained large amounts of gold are actually empty. Gene and Pat, operating as insurance investigators, are sent to investigate the robberies.

title: Civil War at Deadwood
description: Outlaws try to take advantage of a feud between veterans of the Union and Confederate armies when the pair accuse each other of robbery and attempted murder.

title: Boots and Ballots
description: A crooked politician attempts to derail a woman's bid to be elected mayor by kidnapping her adopted son and threatening to kill him unless she withdraws from the election.

roles.char: Music Group at Mary's Election Rally

title: Outlaw Warning
description: After Pat's testimony sends Corey Fordham to prison, the murderous outlaw threatens to kill Pat and Judge Lockwood. Pat happily contemplates spending the reward money he's earned until Fordham breaks away from his guards en route to prison and prepares to carry out his vengeance.

title: The Million Dollar Fiddle
description: A child-prodigy runs away to Gene's ranch carrying his priceless Stradivarius violin. A crooked ranch hand decides to steal the fiddle and find out exactly how much a "priceless" musical instrument is worth.

title: Stage to San Dimas
description: Gene tries to lead a stagecoach filled with a mixed group of passengers safely to San Dimas, as the Apaches and a pair of diamond thieves try to prevent the coach from arriving.

title: The Portrait of White Cloud
description: Gene and Pat's plans to go fishing are sidetracked when they must help a small town Sheriff round up a gang of stagecoach robbers who have shifted the blame for their crimes on to the son of the local Indian Chief.

title: Law Comes to Scorpion
description: Gene and Pat try to help a minister rid a town of crooked politicians and gamblers and are accused of murder.

title: The Golden Chariot
description: After Pat bets and loses the town's school building fund in a crooked chariot race, it's up to Gene to win the fund back.

title: Guns Below the Border
description: U.S. Border Patrol agent Gene Autry and Captain Fernando of the Mexican Federales investigate American gunrunners providing Winchester repeaters to Mexican renegades

title: Ghost Ranch
description: A hard-headed young woman inherits the ranch where Gene and Pat are working and won't honor the verbal monetary agreement Gene had with the former owner. At Pat's instigation, Gene and the other ranch hands try to convince the new owner that the ranch is haunted.

title: Go West, Young Lady
description: Postal inspectors attempting to close down a lonely hearts club racket accuse Gene and Pat of being the ringleaders.

roles.char: Insp. Mary Riley, alias Mary Gridley

title: Feuding Friends
description: Pat and Gene pretend to be bitter enemies in order to smoke out a murderous gang of counterfeiters. Their plan works too well - the gang leader hires Pat to kill Gene and sends his right-hand man to make sure that Gene's sidekick does the job right.

title: Saddle Up
description: With the help of a pretty schoolteacher, Gene and Pat set up a ranch as a home for underprivileged boys. A gang of owlhoots try to force Gene off the ranch by making it appear he's not providing a safe place for the boys to live.

title: Ride Ranchero
description: Gene hires a parolee to help out on his boys' ranch even though the former criminal will inherit the ranch if Gene is proved to unsafe home for his young charges.

title: The Rangerette
description: Pickett plan to gain control of the Flying "A" Ranch hits a snag when he learns that the disgraced heir, Big Jim Weston, has a child.

title: Dynamite
description: Gene and Pat stop a empty stagecoach racing along the road. They backtrack and find the wounded driver and a passenger who claims to be a detective tracking a suspect in a mining disaster.
